Aggregate production ('000 metric tons, may include official, semi-official or estimated data): Total cereals 1,944.2 in 2020; 1,400.7 in 2021; 1,431.2 in 2022; Total fruit (primary) 432.3 in 2020; 358.0 in 2021, 704.0 in 2022; Total oilcrops 97.1 in 2020; 58.3 in 2021; 98.4 in 2022; Total roots and tubers 441.2 in 2020; 339.7 in 2021; 312.9 in 2022; Total vegetables (primary) 812.1 in 2020, 788.1 in 2021; 701.7 in 2022.

gen-list.item: 100 pfeninga = 1 konvertibilna marka (KM or convertible marka).

ss-entry-simple.content-note: Note: The new Bosnia and Herzegovina dinar (BHD) was introduced in August 1994, with an official value fixed at 100 BHD = 1 Deutsche Mark (DM). The DM, the Croatian kuna and the Yugoslav dinar also circulated within Bosnia and Herzegovina. On 22 June 1998 the BHD was replaced by the KM, equivalent to 100 of the former units. The KM was thus at par with the DM. From the introduction of the euro, on 1 January 1999, the German currency had a fixed exchange rate of €1 = DM 1.95583.

table-block-simple.endnote: Figures represent a consolidation of the budgetary accounts of: the central state Government; the federation and cantonal authorities, and social security and road maintenance funds in the Federation; the central republican authorities, local and district administrations, social security and road maintenance funds in Republika Srpska; the central government and health insurance and employment funds in Brčko District

sources.source-info: Ministry of Finance and the Treasury, Sarajevo
